intro: Clusia lanceolata, commonly known as the waxleaf hibiscus, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It features thick, waxy, dark green leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red, typically blooming from spring to fall. It is well adapted to humid climates and thrives in partial to full sun. Clusia lanceolata is popular in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate a range of soil conditions.
